unnormalised: **Fuel Efficiency Takes Center Stage in Auto Market**
normalised: **Fuel Efficiency Takes Center Stage in Auto Market**

unnormalised: Hey folks, petrol prices giving you sleepless nights? You're not alone! The automotive scene is buzzing about fuel efficiency, especially with Diwali around the corner and everyone planning those long drives back home to Kerala or maybe a road trip to Goa.
normalised: Hey folks, petrol prices giving you sleepless nights? You are not alone! The automotive scene is buzzing about fuel efficiency, especially with Diwali around the corner and everyone planning those long drives back home to Kerala or maybe a road trip to Goa.

unnormalised: Manufacturers are finally listening. Maruti Suzuki is reportedly working on some seriously efficient hybrid tech, and even Mahindra is upping its game. Think mileage figures thatâ€™ll make your wallet breathe a sigh of relief!
normalised: Manufacturers are finally listening. Maruti Suzuki is reportedly working on some seriously efficient hybrid tech, and even Mahindra is upping its game. Think mileage figures that will make your wallet breathe a sigh of relief!

unnormalised: Rumors are flying around about Tata Motors testing some revolutionary engine designs. They're claiming some cars can achieve 30 km per litre! Imagine the savings on those trips to your native place. More money for that delicious Onam Sadhya.
normalised: Rumors are flying around about Tata Motors testing some revolutionary engine designs. They are claiming some cars can achieve thirty kilometer per litre! Imagine the savings on those trips to your native place. More money for that delicious Onam Sadhya.

unnormalised: Analysts are saying that fuel efficiency is now the biggest deciding factor for buyers, even more than the fancy infotainment systems. People are willing to trade the large SUV for a smaller car that sips fuel.
normalised: Analysts are saying that fuel efficiency is now the biggest deciding factor for buyers, even more than the fancy infotainment systems. People are willing to trade the large S U V for a smaller car that sips fuel.

unnormalised: Rs. 100+ per litre is no joke, folks! It looks like 'kitna deti hai?' is back with a vengeance, even more important than the 'pehle mileage kitna deti thi?' dialogue in every Indian family, or the debate on if Biryani has potatoes or not!
normalised: Rupees one hundred plus per litre is no joke, folks! It looks like 'kitna deti hai?' is back with a vengeance, even more important than the 'pehle mileage kitna deti thi?' dialogue in every Indian family, or the debate on if Biryani has potatoes or not!
